alert.note: Alert for Western Rogue Basin including the Illinois Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 04 at 7:55PM PDT until September 06 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 620... * IMPACTS...A Haines of 6 on an existing fire can bring the possibility of plume dominated fire behaviour and possible increased spotting. * AFFECTED AREA...In ORZ620...Fire weather zone 620. * WIND...Northwest winds 5 to 10 mph with gusts as high as15 mph. * HUMIDITY...8 to 12 percent. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: If you have not packed your evacuation kit yet, now is the time to do so. This includes items like important documents and essentials you cannot live without. Fill your vehicle`s fuel tank. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Plan now to avoid using equipment that could cause sparks during the period when critical weather conditions are possible. Visit weather.gov/medford/wildfire for links to fire restrictions in your area. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible during the valid watch time. These conditions could promote the rapid spread of wildfires which could become life- threatening. Check weather.gov/medford for forecast updates and a possible upgrade of the this watch to a Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Western Rogue Basin including the Illinois Valley
